Uses of Package
nz.ac.vuw.ecs.swen225.gp21.domain

Packages that use nz.ac.vuw.ecs.swen225.gp21.domain
Package Description
nz.ac.vuw.ecs.swen225.gp21.app  
nz.ac.vuw.ecs.swen225.gp21.domain  
nz.ac.vuw.ecs.swen225.gp21.persistency  
nz.ac.vuw.ecs.swen225.gp21.recorder  
nz.ac.vuw.ecs.swen225.gp21.renderer  
  • Classes in nz.ac.vuw.ecs.swen225.gp21.domain used by nz.ac.vuw.ecs.swen225.gp21.app
    Class Description
    Board
    The Board class is responsible for representing and maintaining the state of the game, such as what type of objects are on the maze, where they are, whether the level is finished and which actions are allowed to change the state of those objects, etc...
    Game
    The Game class handles the clock and interacts with the App module.
  • Classes in nz.ac.vuw.ecs.swen225.gp21.domain used by nz.ac.vuw.ecs.swen225.gp21.domain
    Class Description
    AbstractChap
    An Actor is a game character that moves around, like Chap, the hero of the game.
    AbstractTile
    Superclass of Tiles that make up the maze.
    Board
    The Board class is responsible for representing and maintaining the state of the game, such as what type of objects are on the maze, where they are, whether the level is finished and which actions are allowed to change the state of those objects, etc...
    BoardObjectsToSave
    For PERSISTENCY to use when saving game To avoid calling multiple methods in Board from the Persistency module.
    Direction
    Enumerates which directions we can travel from current position.
    Game
    The Game class handles the clock and interacts with the App module.
    KeyDoorColour
    Enumerates KeyTile and LockedDoorTile's colours.
    KeyTile
    Actors can move onto those tiles.
    Position
    Position of Actor or Tile on board.
    RegularChap
    Chap can be moved by key strokes (up-right-down-left), his movement is restricted by the nature of the tiles (for instance, cannot move into walls).
    VariantChap
    The secondary actor used in level 2.

    Direction
    Enumerates which directions we can travel from current position.
